intro: Lacmellea macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered lacmellea, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
